title: A streaming brain-to-voice neuroprosthesis to restore naturalistic communication
description: Neural and biosignal datasets from a clinical trial involving a brain-to-voice speech neuroprosthesis for a single participant with paralysis. Includes ECoG, EMG, and MEA recordings.
full_description: This dataset supports a study demonstrating a real-time streaming brain-to-voice speech synthesizer. The study involved a single clinical trial participant with severe paralysis and anarthria. High-density electrocorticography (ECoG) data from the speech sensorimotor cortex were used to drive a neural decoder. Additional silent-speech interface modalities included intramuscular EMG and Utah array-based single-unit microelectrode array (MEA) recordings. All shared datasets are deidentified, and the participant’s personalized voice synthesizer is replaced with a generic voice model for anonymity.
number_of_channels: Varies by modality (e.g., high-density ECoG grid, Utah array)
citation: Littlejohn K. T., Cho C. J., Liu J. R., et al. (2025). A streaming brain-to-voice neuroprosthesis to restore naturalistic communication. Nature Neuroscience, 28, 902–912.
